turn.9: Is there anything else that is important?
turn.10: One sees that the Hohmann transfer is always more efficient if the ratio of radii formula_40 is smaller than 11.94.
turn.12: On the other hand, if the radius of the final orbit is more than 15.58 times larger than the radius of the initial orbit, then any bi-elliptic transfer, regardless of its apoapsis radius (as long as it's larger than the radius of the final orbit), requires less formula_23 than a Hohmann transfer.
